head.title: Where to Find Your Bag: Just Look Under Your Martini

hedline.hl1: Where to Find Your Bag: Just Look Under Your Martini

abstract.p: Several bars in Manhattan install hooks under bar, so customers can keep their bags close to them and within eyesight; photo (S)

block.p: The handbag on the floor. The handbag hanging from the back of a stool. The handbag gone, disappearing amid the happy hour mayhem at a bar. It happens all too often.

Several bars in Manhattan have installed hooks under the bar, so that customers can keep their bags closer to them and within eyesight. Among such considerate spots are St. Andrews in the theater district; Do Hwa, a Korean place in Greenwich Village; and Good World Bar and Grill, a Scandinavian spot on the edge of Chinatown. Republic, a noodle restaurant on Union Square, has bins under the tables for bags.
